definition: front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly

sentences.english: The dooryard used to be the place where we enjoyed sunshine in the winter afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 前院是我們冬日下午裏曬太陽的地方。

sentences.english: In this front courtyard left side, you may free receive the bamboo tube to carry on ask the bamboo slip.
sentences.chinese: 在這個前院的左側，沒關係收費支付竹筒舉辦求籤。

sentences.english: There are long queues on petrol forecourts.
There was a big banian in the front courtyard of the house where my father was born.
sentences.chinese: 在我父親出生的房子前院，原來有一棵大榕樹。

sentences.english: The production hall evolves along the road, whereas the tasting area is orientated with its viewing side towards the forecourt.
sentences.chinese: 生產車間沿着道路建造，而在品嚐區可以看到前院。

sentences.english: The front yard is a garden with many beautiful flowers and plants for the four seasons.
sentences.chinese: 前院是一個小花園，有許多美麗的四季花卉花和植物。

sentences.english: Is uncle Huang's fair still disliking front yard son those women loud.
sentences.chinese: 皇叔方纔還嫌前院兒那些女人吵呢。

sentences.english: As I walked toward the house I saw a lady doing chores in the front courtyard.
sentences.chinese: 我朝農宅走過去，看見一個女人正在前院幹雜活。

sentences.english: He fell into the habit of making suggestions for rearranging the tiny front-yard landscapes.
sentences.chinese: 他漸漸習慣了建議別人重新佈置前院的景觀。

definition: reception pavilion (generally part of a large residence, and often built in a garden)
central building (in a traditional house)/primary wife
central room of a traditional Chinese house
